Rivian Software Updates: When You'll Get Yours & How It Actually Works
 Last updated: December 21, 2025
 How Rivian rolls out software updates — wave distribution, download methods, and what actually affects when you'll get yours.
 The Short Version
 Connect+ moves you up, not to the front — still ~3 days from release
 Rollouts happen on business days — no weekend or holiday pushes
 Parking on WiFi won't get you flagged sooner — flagging is Rivian's call; WiFi just speeds up the download after
 Queue position is random — location, order date, mileage don't matter
 The Rivian app won't show anything at flagging — it waits until download completes; Rivian Roamer alerts earlier
 Software Update Process Overview
 Release
 Flagging
 1-5 days
 Download
 30min-8h
 Verification
 ~20 min
 Installation
 ~45 min
 Completion
 Each step of the update process is explained in detail below.
 1
 Software Release
 Rivian regularly releases software updates with new features and improvements. These updates are typically distributed in waves over a ~5-day period.
 Wave Distribution System
 1
 First ~3 Days: Connect+ subscribers and trial users receive priority in early waves
 2
 Final ~2 Days: Remaining vehicles receive the update
 Early
 Connect+
 Middle
 Connect+
 Later
 All
 Wave Propagation
 Earlier waves include only a small percentage of the fleet, creating a natural probability of most owners being in later waves
 Each subsequent wave includes a larger percentage of vehicles until all eligible vehicles are covered
 This gradual approach helps Rivian detect any issues early before wider distribution
 Technical Facts
 WiFi connection, location, and order date have no impact on when you'll be flagged
 Selection within waves is random
 2
 Vehicle Flagging
 1-5 days
 When your vehicle is selected in a wave, it gets "flagged" for the update on Rivian's servers.
 This happens automatically whether your vehicle is online or offline.
 Important: The Rivian mobile app provides no indication when your vehicle is flagged. You'll only know your vehicle has been flagged by either checking your vehicle's center display or through Rivian Roamer with a linked account.
 Get Early Notifications
 Rivian Roamer users with linked accounts receive immediate notifications when their vehicle is flagged, giving you time to plan for download and installation.
 Be the first to know about updates!
 Sign Up Free
 3
 Download Process
 WiFi: 30min-2h
 After being flagged, your vehicle needs to download the update package. There are two main ways this happens:
 WiFi
 Recommended
 Speed:
 Fastest option
 Time:
 30 min - 2 hours
 For:
 All users
 Note: Flagged vehicles start downloading immediately when connected to WiFi. Mobile hotspots work too!
 Cellular
 Slower
 Speed:
 Much slower
 Time:
 1 - 8 hours
 For:
 Connect+ subscribers and trial users
 Note: Serves as fallback if WiFi fails after a few attempts. Emergency updates may use cellular for all vehicles.
 Key Download Information
 Update packages are typically multi-GB in size
 Connection errors may resolve automatically
 Rivian Roamer users: Track download progress in real-time on your dashboard.
 Seeing "Connection Lost"? Check the troubleshooting section.
 4
 Verification
 ~20 min
 Once downloaded, your vehicle verifies the update package before installation.
 Verification Process
 Post-download integrity verification
 Security signature validation
 Installation package preparation
 Official Rivian app notification occurs after this stage
 This process happens automatically and requires no user interaction.
 5
 Installation
 ~45 min
 When your update is ready to install, you can initiate it from the Rivian mobile app, your vehicle's touchscreen, or it will install automatically if you've enabled scheduled software updates. Regardless of method, these requirements must be met:
 Installation Requirements
 Vehicle in Park
 35+ miles of range
 Not connected to DC fast charger
 Pet Mode disabled
 Tire Change Mode disabled
 12V battery is healthy
 What to Expect During Installation
 Strange sounds may occur, this is normal
 In-vehicle screens may be temporarily off or unresponsive
 Vehicle controls, including locks may be unresponsive
 Mobile app control unavailable during installation
 6
 Completion
 After installation completes and your vehicle restarts, you'll be running the latest software.
 Follow on-screen prompts for a guided update experience.
 Consider bringing your key fob to the vehicle after an update, as it may receive updates when in proximity to the vehicle.
 See what's new in recent releases
 Rivian Autonomy+ Data Updates
 Separate from main vehicle software updates, Rivian Autonomy+ (RAP) data updates download in the background whenever your Gen 2 vehicle (2025+) is connected to WiFi. These background downloads operate independently of regular software updates.
 Downloads automatically in the background
 Installs without notification or vehicle restart
 Troubleshooting
 Connection Issues
 If you see Connection Lost status, follow these steps:
 Verify WiFi signal strength
 Try alternate WiFi network
 Connect+ users: try disabling WiFi to force cellular download
 Last resort: perform steering wheel button reset
 Installation Problems
 If installation fails, try these solutions:
 Verify all prerequisites met
 Wait 24 hours before retrying
 Ensure adequate connectivity
 Contact Rivian support for persistent issues
